reviews.review_msg: I THINK IT IS TIME TO RETIRE

Great professor! The class was actually SA443 - very discussion-based class, really interesting content and she taught it well. Completely open to student feedback and is there to help when needed. Would definitely take again!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! NO KIDDING!! IF YOU CARE FOR YOUR SANITY AND PEACE, PLEASE AVOID HER! She does NOT teach!  Students do their own learning and when she "teaches" her explanations are terrible and incomprehensible! Her last name even says it ALL! Please please please avoid this lecturer and if unfortunately, you can't, well sorry and GOODLUCK!

not a fair grader or good at teaching how to write for a heavy extensive writing class. Feedback is never helpful because it's always 'this is not correct' rather than explaining where you went wrong. Very critical and harsh at grading written assignments for an easy 2nd year class. The course and readings are easy but her grading is not awful.
She requires a lot of work with no help or clear direction Multiple assignments due a week with lots of readings.
Stern, was quite unprofessional with her mannerisms in the classroom. Avoid if you can.

I think Pam is one of those Prof's that you either really vibe with or do not like. Overall, I think she is a fair marker and is passionate about what she teaches. I thought the assignments were fair and interesting. Sometimes class discussions were a bit dry but overall I enjoyed the class and would take one of her classes again!

Assignments are straightforward; they are short writing assignments but there are quite a few of them for the semester. She gives awesome feedback on written work, more than what you think. My only issue with the course, was how the lecture material was presented - it was little dry. But other than that, it was a fair course.
Has a great ability to let the class struggle with a question and lead the lecture. Extremely knowledgable.
Avoid at all costs
so boring, her lectures are hard to listen to and it doesnt even matter cause its all common sense and theres no exams. if you show up and put minimal effort you will be able to do well.

Pam is a professor I had to learn to love. Her marking scheme was often unclear and you wouldn't find out what she was looking for till you got your work back. We did multiple exercises to improve our writing skills and I really appreciate her for that. The textbook used was by her but it's a great collection of ethnographies that were made easy.

Yeah don't take her class, you will buy the textbook she wrote so good luck with presenting your own ideas. TA seemed more up to date than professor, grading is very brutal and there is not much emphasis on helping students become better writers in the course, bad office hrsAlso speaking in her class is not very well received, skip this one folks.

Stern replies to people's opinions with either a "uh okay" or a "you're wrong" yet expect all of us to participate  Reading assignments due almost every week with unclear instructions and unfair grades Not sure why she's still at sfu

Guidelines for assignments are vague.  Encourages discussion, but lectures can be dull nonetheless.  Avoid her if you don't need SA356.  Marking scheme for the course includes 4 fieldnote journals, 4 assignments based on those fieldnotes, attendance/participation, 3 methods summaries for the readings, and a Pechakucha presentation.

I thought I enjoyed her, only to be disappointed later in the semester. She's a hard marker and this particular class requires a lot of participation (it's a small class). The instructions on her reading responses also aren't the clearest.
She is a horrible professor who is incredible ignorant. She ignores valid opinions made by her students and attempts to belittle them whenever possible. I strongly recommend avoiding her.

Pam is AMAZING! Super engaging and funny. Heavy course load (we're working on a collaborative research project as a class) but all of the assignments have been very useful and practical. Pam's so helpful and provides incredible feedback on all assignments. Favourite prof at SFU thus far. I highly recommend taking a class with Pam.

I'd like to point out that this isn't highschool and that the level of attention and critical thinking that she demands is nothing out of the ordinary.I personally thought her classes were fascinating and she has a lot to offer if you pay attention. My papers were all done last minute but I never got less than 8 out of 10.

-Honestly she stutters so much you lose your train of thought, and i went from having 90% average in english 12 and my essays too getting 5's and 6's out of tens on hers.. - I would NEVER ever take her EVER again LOL.

Disappointing! Did not link themes to books/articles read. Seminar discussion was often dominated by her, not the students (except the one or two favourites she had in class). There was no need for this class to be a 4 hour seminar - there was no collaborative learning, nor respective of various perspectives whatsoever. Skip this prof!
She does demand a lot of work, but she is an expert on the Inuit. I learend a lot from her, it was pretty interesting.

Be prepared to hear endlessly about the Inuit. Every single example relates back to them. Also, her exams are brutal. Very fine details from a reading that are irrelevant. Near impossible multiple choice.
I've learned a lot from her

Tough marker. Very fickle. Strange way of grading assignments. Didn't feel I learnt too much. Would have liked to use the text and the theories in there a lot more. Strict with guidelines and what she requires in her assignments. Will give you advise, but doesn't come off that approachable. High interest in the subject. Decent seminar arrangement.

Pamela is a pretty brutal professor. Her assignment instructions are super vague, and those which seem like they should be worth more aren't and vice versa. She puts a 10% emphasis on participation, yet responds rudely ("oh.." "ok" or just simply "no that's wrong") when you participate. Very frustrating professor.
Good prof
Don't take this class if you want an easy A. Take this class if you want to be challenged to think in new ways. Prof Stern is awesome.
I learned a lot from this course
She made me realize that mental health is a social issue.

Rude, vague, boring, and incoherent.Depth required for a topic covered is around what we already knew before.Exams and assignments have terrible criteria that are hard to understand and everyone loses lots of marks for stupid things. Very picky about things other then content. Stupid overall, coming from a decent student who studies and enjoys hsci
She does not seem qualified to teach this class. Her midterm was a joke, there were at least 6 questions that had more than one right answer. She is not friendly and not helpful.

The topics discussed are easy to understand, however, I would advise taking this class NOT with Pamela Stern.  She is very rude, and inconsiderate of students. We also had to do a "current event" every week with the newspaper, which was pointless.
